section_a.beneficiaries: Tha company’s activities will provide benefit to... e Undertow CIC provides creative sessions using storytelling to support mental health, wellbeing and recovery to vulnerable groups in the community. e Undertow CiC is for vulnerable groups within communities. We exist to assist in the processing of trauma. Potential users of Undertow could be but are not limited to; refugees and asylum seekers, looked after children, homeless, LGBTQIA+ and ethnic minority groups. e The value proposition of our offering comes in the deep history and working experience of our founder who has both an academic grounding in the tools as well as 10 years experience of practice building safe places and catharsis for participants. Since 2012 Dr Kat Lewis has worked with groups across the country and all over the world as a freelance practitioner. Kent has been her home for four years and she has consciously chosen to set up her business here where the community can benefit broadly from her services. e Squeezed between London and the English channel and housing some of the most poverty stricken native Brits, Kent is particular in it’s community needs and Undertow is particularly skilled in assisting to address these
